critique: This executive order aims to promote women's business enterprises through affirmative action and interagency coordination. It directs federal departments and agencies to support women-owned businesses through various means, including financial assistance, training, and procurement. It establishes an Interagency Committee on Women's Business Enterprise to oversee and coordinate these efforts. The order emphasizes affirmative action and aims to address discrimination against women in business. It also includes definitions for "women-owned business" and "women's business enterprise." The order does not directly address immigration, national security, or civil liberties. It could be seen as expanding federal power to regulate economic activity and promote social inclusion.
